description: Consider the sequence {b(m)} of composite numbers (excluding 1); sequence gives values of m where gcd{m, b(m)} increases.
example: a(4) = 12 because twelve is the sixth composite number and the GCD(6,12) > GCD(5,10).
mathematica: r=0; Do[a = GCD[n, n - PrimePi[n] -1]; If[a > r, r = a; Print[n]], {n, 1, 10^6} ]
author: _Robert G. Wilson v_, Nov 13 2000
